IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Supporting individuals during challenging periods empowers them to overcome difficulties stand on their own feet and provide for themselves and their families. Saharo Foundation focuses on four major categories of assistance: Women Empowerment Helping Hand Education and Medical support.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Saharo Foundation has been a beacon of support for over 50 families and individuals facing challenging circumstances. By providing assistance during these difficult periods we empower them to overcome obstacles regain their footing and ensure the well-being of themselves and their families. Additionally we have granted 10 yearly scholarships established a women's skills center facilitated the purchase of furniture for schools and engaged in various small-scale activities. Our foundation is committed to making a positive impact in four major categories: Women Empowerment Helping Hand Education and Medical Support. Your collaboration and generosity play a vital role in addressing critical needs within these areas and fostering positive change.
IRS990.Desc: Empower impoverished families struggling to afford even a single meal through our impactful program. Operated under the banner of malnutrition in collaboration with Saharo READ this initiative has successfully aided thousands of individuals and families ensuring they receive the essential nourishment needed for a healthier and more sustainable life.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Offering support to talented and underprivileged students this initiative aims to integrate them as valuable contributors to their families. Primarily targeting economically challenged girls and boys the project provides essential resources such as books fees uniforms and occasionally extends assistance to schools by addressing fundamental classroom needs for the benefit of the students. Through this endeavor we empower students to become self-reliant and contribute positively to their families and communities.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Empowering families especially women to become self-sufficient the Helping Hand program assists in providing the necessary resources for them to stand on their own. By offering support in acquiring equipment for endeavors like food preparation small shops or transportation services we enable individuals to initiate and sustain activities that contribute to the well-being of their families. Helping Hand initiative makes a significant impact fostering independence and resilience within these communities.

GrantsToOrgOutsideUSGrp.PurposeOfGrantTxt: Girl School Renovation, treatment to cancer patients, scholarships, education assistance, food and medicines.
GrantsToOrgOutsideUSGrp.DescriptionOfNonCashAsstTxt: Saharo Foundation employs a meticulous and strategic approach in harnessing grants to maximize their impact in advancing our mission and objectives. The utilization of grants follows a systematic process aimed at ensuring transparency, accountability, and the most effective allocation of resources.

ForeignIndividualsGrantsGrp.TypeOfAssistanceTxt: Education assistance school rennovation medical treatment and life-saving support.
ForeignIndividualsGrantsGrp.DescriptionOfNonCashAsstTxt: Saharo Foundation employs a meticulous and strategic approach in harnessing grants to maximize their impact in advancing our mission and objectives. The utilization of grants follows a systematic process aimed at ensuring transparency accountability and the most effective allocation of resources.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Saharo Foundation did not receive any grants in 2021. Saharo Foundation has a meticulous and strategic approach in harnessing individual grants to maximize their impact in advancing our mission and objectives. The utilization of grants follows a systematic process aimed at ensuring transparency accountability and the most effective allocation of resources.

In 2022 Saharo Foundation encountered its first requirement to file Form 990 for Tax Year 2021. As a precautionary measure to ensure compliance with deadlines the organization initially submitted Form 990N on May 1st 2022. Subsequently in an attempt to fulfill the filing requirements comprehensively Saharo Foundation also sent a mailed version of Form 990 with amendments inadvertently overlooking the online filing necessity a procedural oversight attributed to the organization's first-time experience with this process. Recent communication with the Internal Revenue Service IRS brought to light that only the Form 990N submission had been received. In response Saharo Foundation promptly provided the IRS with a copy of the Year 2021 tax return. Regrettably the IRS returned the submission directing Saharo Foundation to complete the filing through the online platform. It is crucial to highlight that these circumstances marked by the organization's initial unfamiliarity with the online filing requirement and subsequent corrective efforts constitute the primary reasons for the delayed amendment filing for Tax Year 2021.

Annual financial statements were transparently presented to the government body during a monthly meeting. To ensure clarity a comprehensive question-and-answer session accompanied by a detailed PowerPoint presentation was conducted. This interactive approach aimed to make the governing body fully aware of the intricacies of Form 990 and the financial statements. Transparency and open communication are core principles guiding our commitment to accountability and stakeholder engagement.
Yes the organization regularly and consistently monitored and enforced compliance with the policy.

Going above and beyond we have provided financial assistance to more than two dozen families fostering sustainable economic avenues that contribute to their overall well-being., $19970, $19970, $0|
